title: A Tour in Tartan-Land
author: Bede, Cuthbert
snippet: Wallace's ' Cast' or camp is not far to the north-west of this cave, on the other side of that pretty burn which is one of the Esk's tributaries, and which bears a name suggestive to English midland county ears of the very antipodes to poetry and the picturesque—viz. Bilston.

title: Travels in lands beyond the sea.
author: Linskill, Charles Dorrance.
snippet: His body lay on the metals for over an hour and a half before it was discovered. At Bilston a woman walked into the canal and was drowned. At Willenhall a carrier was driving to Walsall, when his horse got off the main road and fell into an open work.

title: Hill-side and border sketches:
author: Maxwell, W. H.
snippet: " Home ! Is not Caerlavarock — is not Bilston open to thee, George ? What want ye beyond these ?"
